Posts.Content: Hi Hannah So sorry to hear your sad news but uve found the right place to talk through it and get plenty of support. I'm only 32 and was diagnosed with invasive breast cancer with a 3.9cm lump. Like you I had biopsies, mammogram and ultrasound on the same day and then went for MRI. I have been through my lumpectomy and node removal. The node removal is not very pleasant but the lumpectomy has been ok. The worst pain is the bruising. I had mine done through my nipple and was lucky as my node removal was done through the same scar. I was in and out of hospital the same day. I find I can only lie on my back in bed as when I lie on my side it feels like all the tissue in my boob is going to one side. It's quite uncomfortable. Unfortunately I don't have children so at the moment I am going through the egg collection process having to inject myself everyday. Once this is all done I have to undergo FEC/T chemo for 6 months, then radiotherapy and also hormone tablets for 5 years. It's gonna be a bumpy ride but I'm gonna get through it and come out stronger at the end. It's quite difficult to write everything down without sounding like an essay so if you have any questions at all just give me a shout. The questions that seem the most silly will probably help you more than the sensible ones :) Please be careful what you read there is a lot of crap on the net. I'm here if you need anything hunni Look forward to hearing from you Lots of hugs Nic xx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed :'( 35 years old

Posts.Content: Hi Hannah You will be strong next week I just know it. You find strength I have no idea where it comes from but you just do. Suppose it's the knowing we just have to get on with it. Stay positive chicken we ate all here with you :) I know you're worried about the scarring ( I was scared) but then you just have to think we are the lucky ones as we get to keep out boobs. I am a 34 D and my boob that had the lumpectomy is now a size smaller. I can get taut very to make them both the same size but I'm not bothered. I just feel thankful to still have them both. Unfortunately my lymph nodes were not clear. They only took 2 and found a pea sized cancer in 1 of them. The day I was told about this I was too excited because I got clear margins so did not ask about the lymph node. Been having a few scary thoughts lately so I'm gonna ask my surgeon a few questions on Tuesday at my next check up. The egg collection process lasts roughly 3 weeks if all goes to plan. You say you wouldn't be brave enough to inject yourself, truth is I'm not my boyfriend David has been doing it for me haha. Think I make him a wreck everytime haha. We are freezing embryos not just my eggs so that just basically means we mix my eggs with David's stuff (technical term) then they get frozen. It's amazing what they can do. Well done you on thinking so positively and setting yourself goals for next year. U go girl!!!! Lots of hugs Nic xx
